bot.title: Bot Configuration
bot.selectAdDescription: You must select an advertisement to configure the bot parameters
bot.advertiserTypeDescription: Select which type of advertisers you want to compete with. This will filter competitor ads based on the publisher type.
bot.allPaymentMethodsDescription: If you select 'All payment methods', the bot will compete with any available method. If you prefer specific methods, deselect this option and check the ones you need.
bot.conservativeDescription: The Conservative mode ensures your ad is positioned first, but with a sufficient margin to avoid being easily outbid by competitors.
bot.aggressiveDescription: The Aggressive mode is configured to challenge competitor bots, pushing them to their maximum limit and constantly outbidding them.
bot.positionBasedDescription: The Fixed Position mode allows you to select exactly which position in the list you want to appear, maintaining this position consistently.
bot.targetPositionDescription: Select which position in the ad list you want your ad to appear. The bot will automatically adjust the price to maintain this position.
bot.noAdsMessage: There are no published ads for this account. Please create ads before configuring the bot.
bot.priceLimitDescription: Maximum price at which the bot will operate. This limit acts as a protection to prevent the bot from operating at prices that are unfavorable to your business strategy.
bot.priceFixedInfo: Maximum price at which the bot will operate. This limit acts as a protection to prevent the bot from operating at prices that are unfavorable to your business strategy.
bot.priceVariableDescription:
Percentage of the market price that will be applied as a limit (range: 90-135%).

100% = Exact market price
<100% = Discount (e.g.: 99.5% = 0.5% below market)
>100% = Premium (e.g.: 101% = 1% above market)
bot.priceVariableInfo: The bot will use the current market price from Binance and apply the configured percentage as a limit.
bot.variablePriceInfo: The bot will use the current market price and apply the configured percentage as a limit.
bot.availableAssetDescription: Sets the minimum amount of cryptocurrency or fiat that a competitor's ad must have available for the bot to consider it in its analysis. This helps filter out ads that cannot meet the desired transaction volume.
bot.availableAssetOperation: • Buy (BUY) and Sell (SELL): In both cases, the bot uses this parameter to ensure that competitor ads have enough available quantity to satisfy your transaction needs. If an ad does not meet this limit, it will be ignored in the analysis.
bot.availableAssetBenefit: Benefit: By setting this value, you ensure that the bot only considers ads that can actually meet your transaction volume expectations, avoiding interactions with ads that are not suitable for your business objectives.
bot.paymentMethodsDescription: Select the payment methods you want to compete with. The bot will only consider competitor ads that use these payment methods.
bot.proMerchantAdsDescription: Filter ads to show only those from merchants with PRO badge.
bot.proMerchantAdsHelp: PRO merchants typically have higher liquidity and better prices.
bot.labelsDescription: Add labels to easily identify this bot when you have multiple bots in the same account.
bot.noLabels: No labels. Add labels to identify this bot.

transAmountDescription.main: Sets the transaction size that the bot will use to filter and analyze competitor ads. This ensures that the bot only considers ads that are relevant to the transaction volume you want to perform.
transAmountDescription.operation: • Buy (BUY) and Sell (SELL): Regardless of whether the bot is configured to buy or sell, transAmount is used to search for ads that can satisfy the desired transaction volume. This means that the bot will ignore ads that do not meet this minimum amount criterion, focusing only on those that are relevant to your needs.
transAmountDescription.benefit: Benefit: By defining a transAmount, you ensure that the bot focuses on ads that can actually meet your transaction volume expectations, avoiding wasting time on ads that are not suitable for your business objectives.

priceDifferenceThresholdDescription.main: This parameter defines the minimum difference that the bot will consider when deciding its position in the competitors list.
priceDifferenceThresholdDescription.operationBuy: If the price difference between the 1st and 2nd competitor is greater than this value, the bot will position itself below the first competitor instead of trying to be in first place.
priceDifferenceThresholdDescription.operationSell: Example: If you set the value to 10 units, the 1st competitor has a price of 100, and the 2nd competitor has a price of 88 (difference of 12 with the 1st), since 12 is greater than 10, the bot will position itself as 2nd instead of 1st.
priceDifferenceThresholdDescription.benefit: Benefit: This strategic approach allows you to maintain a balance between visibility and profitability, avoiding unnecessary price wars with other bots.

bot.priceAdjustmentDescription: Determines how much the price of your ad will be increased or decreased to position itself competitively against competitor ads.
bot.noBotsFound: No bots found for this Binance account.
bot.noAdWarning: This bot is not linked to any active ad. You need to set up an ad for the bot to work properly.
bot.hoverInfo: Hover over help icons for more information
bot.deleteConfirmation: Delete bot (does not affect the ad)

security.title: Guaranteed Security
security.description: We only need basic trading permissions. By activating only "Enable Reading" and "Enable Spot & Margin Trading" in your Binance API Keys, we ensure secure operation.
security.readingDescription: To read balances, orders and trading history
security.tradingDescription: To execute buy and sell orders
security.withdrawalsDescription: We don't request or need fund withdrawal permissions
security.modificationDescription: We can't modify any of your account settings
security.withdrawalRequirements: Binance requires special permissions and multiple confirmations to enable withdrawals, including:
security.revocationDescription: You can revoke the API Key permissions at any time from your Binance dashboard, giving you full control over access.

questions.title: How does the free trial period work?
questions.content: You get full access to all features for 7 days, with no commitment. No credit card required to start.

questions.title: Is it safe to use Binance API Keys?
questions.content: Yes, the API Keys we use only have trading permissions, with no withdrawal access. Plus, you can revoke permissions anytime from Binance.

questions.title: What happens if I want to cancel my subscription?
questions.content: You can cancel at any time. There are no long-term contracts or cancellation penalties.

questions.title: What technical support do you offer?
questions.content: We offer 24/7 technical support via email and chat. Our team is always available to help you.

questions.title: How do you protect my data?
questions.content: We use military-grade encryption for your API Keys and data. Our systems are constantly monitored and audited.

questions.title: Can I use the bot with multiple accounts?
questions.content: Yes, depending on your chosen plan, you can connect multiple Binance accounts to the bot.

conservative.title: Conservative Mode
conservative.description: The bot maintains a competitive but conservative price, prioritizing maintaining safe margins over occupying specific positions in the market.
conservative.increasingPrice: In this case, it's increasing the price to take advantage of a stable market.
conservative.decreasingPrice: In this case, it's reducing the price to stay competitive.

aggressive.title: Aggressive Mode
aggressive.description: The bot focuses on competing directly with a specific advertiser, trying to match or improve their price to capture their trading volume.
aggressive.increasingPrice: It's increasing the price to attack competitor {competitor}.
aggressive.decreasingPrice: It's reducing the price to stay competitive against {competitor}.

positionBased.title: Position Based Mode
positionBased.description: The bot adjusts the price with the goal of maintaining a specific position in the market ranking (position #{position}).
positionBased.increasingPrice: It's increasing the price to adjust to the target position.
positionBased.decreasingPrice: It's reducing the price to reach the target position.
